skill.description: Expert AWS solution architecture for startups focusing on serverless, scalable, and cost-effective cloud infrastructure with modern DevOps practices and infrastructure-as-code
skill.summary: Expert AWS solution architecture for startups focusing on serverless, scalable, and cost-effective c...
skill.author: alirezarezvani

security_audit.summary: All 163 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The skill is a legitimate AWS architecture design tool. Detected patterns are standard AWS terminology (Control Plane), date version strings (IAM policy version 2012-10-17), and documentation examples. No network calls, no external commands, no credential exfiltration. The skill generates CloudFormation, CDK, and Terraform templates locally without any malicious behavior.

content.value_statement: Design production-ready AWS architectures with serverless patterns, cost optimization strategies, and infrastructure-as-code templates for CloudFormation, CDK, and Terraform.
actual_capabilities: Generate architecture patterns for serverless, microservices, and three-tier applications
Create production-ready CloudFormation, AWS CDK, and Terraform templates
Analyze AWS spending and recommend cost optimization strategies
Design multi-region high availability and disaster recovery architectures
Provide compliance guidance for HIPAA, SOC 2, and GDPR requirements
limitations: Does not execute or deploy infrastructure - generates templates only
Requires AWS account and manual deployment by the user
Cannot access real AWS resources or billing data without user input
Recommendations are based on best practices, not live resource analysis

use_cases.title: Design MVP architecture
use_cases.description: Create cost-effective serverless architecture for launch with auto-scaling and minimal operational overhead

use_cases.title: Generate IaC templates
use_cases.description: Produce CloudFormation, CDK, or Terraform configurations for production deployment pipelines

use_cases.title: Optimize cloud costs
use_cases.description: Analyze spending patterns and receive actionable recommendations to reduce AWS bills by 20-40%

prompt_templates.title: Basic Architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a serverless API backend for a mobile app with 100k users using Lambda, API Gateway, and DynamoDB

prompt_templates.title: Cost Optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my AWS setup and recommend ways to reduce costs by 30%. I am currently spending $2000/month on EC2 and RDS

prompt_templates.title: Infrastructure as Code
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a CloudFormation template for a three-tier web application with auto-scaling, RDS, and ElastiCache

prompt_templates.title: Event-Driven Architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Design an event-driven microservices architecture using EventBridge, Step Functions, and SQS for an e-commerce platform

output_examples.input: Design a serverless backend for a SaaS platform with 10k users
output: Services: S3 + CloudFront, API Gateway + Lambda, DynamoDB, Cognito
Key components: Auto-scaling, pay-per-use pricing, high availability
Implementation phases: Foundation (1 week), Core Services (2 weeks), Security & Monitoring (1 week)

output_examples.input: Generate Terraform configuration for my app
output: Terraform resources: DynamoDB table, Cognito user pool, Lambda function, API Gateway, IAM roles
Provider configuration: AWS region, variable definitions
Security settings: Encryption at rest, point-in-time recovery, least privilege IAM policies
Output values: API URL, User Pool ID, Table Name for reference

output_examples.input: How can I reduce my $5000/month AWS bill?
output: Priority actions: Release idle EC2 instances ($200/month savings), consolidate NAT Gateways ($45/month), enable S3 lifecycle policies ($50/month)
Short-term: Purchase Reserved Instances for predictable workloads (30% savings)
Medium-term: Migrate to Aurora Serverless for variable databases (40% savings)
Long-term: Implement VPC endpoints to reduce data transfer costs

best_practices: Start with serverless patterns for MVPs to minimize costs and operational overhead
Use infrastructure-as-code (CloudFormation, CDK, or Terraform) for all deployments
Implement multi-layer security: VPC isolation, IAM least privilege, encryption at rest and in transit
anti_patterns: Avoid over-engineering early - do not build for 10M users when you have 100
Do not use On-Demand pricing for predictable workloads - use Savings Plans or Reserved Instances
Never hardcode credentials - use IAM roles and AWS Secrets Manager instead

faq.question: Does this skill deploy resources to my AWS account?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates infrastructure-as-code templates (CloudFormation, CDK, Terraform) that you manually deploy using AWS CLI or console.

faq.question: What AWS services are supported?
faq.answer: Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB, S3, CloudFront, Cognito, RDS, ECS Fargate, EventBridge, Step Functions, and 20+ other AWS services.

faq.question: Can this analyze my current AWS spending?
faq.answer: Yes, provide your resource inventory and monthly spend, and the skill will recommend specific cost optimizations with estimated savings.

faq.question: Does this work with multi-cloud setups?
faq.answer: Primarily AWS-focused. Terraform templates can be adapted for Azure or GCP with manual modifications.

faq.question: What compliance frameworks are covered?
faq.answer: HIPAA for healthcare, SOC 2 for security, GDPR for EU data residency, and PCI-DSS for payment processing.

faq.question: How do I deploy the generated templates?
faq.answer: Use AWS CLI for CloudFormation, npm/CDK CLI for CDK stacks, or Terraform CLI for Terraform configurations. Each template includes deployment instructions.
